p: The primary reanalysis product used to act as our reference data set was the European Centre for Medium‐Range Weather Forecasts dataset ERA‐Interim (Dee et al., 2011), covering the period 1979–2011. To bolster confidence in the results, and to estimate the potential sampling variability of the metrics inherent to the real atmosphere, we also utilized the NCEP/NCAR reanalysis data set (Kalnay et al., 1996), hereafter referred to as NCEP, and the Japanese 55‐year reanalysis (abbr. JRA55; see Kobayashi et al., 2015). In general, the difference between the three data sets for a given metric were small, being an order of magnitude smaller than the model biases and the impacts seen from a resolution change. Because all three data sets show such close agreement, we will only present explicit values for ERA‐Interim and NCEP in tables/figures.
